title: Easy DIY Worm Farm | Worm Farming for Beginners | Worm Farm Anywhere | Hey It's A Good Life

subtasks: Obtaining bedding material (e.g., soil, compost, sphagnum peat moss, cocoa coir)
Acquiring worms (e.g., from a recommended farm)
Gathering carbon-rich materials (e.g., leaves, shredded paper, cardboard)
Collecting food scraps (e.g., fruit and vegetable scraps, avoiding certain items)
Adding grit (e.g., coffee grounds, eggshells) for digestive purposes
Choosing a bin (e.g., a storage tote) and ensuring proper aeration (drilling holes)
Layering materials in the bin (bedding, worms, carbon, food scraps, grit)
Adjusting moisture level to that of a wrung-out sponge
Addressing potential worm stress in the first 24-72 hours
Monitoring texture and moisture for optimal conditions

tasks.task: Building a community and seeking feedback
subtasks: Engaging with subscribers via comments and social media
Planning future milestones (e.g., 5k subscribers) and community events
